thread.title: Rain pushes KVAC Class A/B shootouts to Oct. 5
thread.title_full: Rain pushes KVAC Class A/B shootouts to Oct. 5

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Rain pushes KVAC Class A/B shootouts to Oct. 5
text:
Rain pushes KVAC Class A/B shootouts to Oct. 5 Seven squads, including Mount View of Thorndike, vie for conference titles By Staff | Sep 30, 2015 
Rockland — Due to heavy rain throughout the Midcoast, the Kennebec Valley Athletic Conference Class A and B high school golf shootouts scheduled for Wednesday, Sept. 30 at the Rockland Golf Club have been postponed. 
The announcement was made late Tuesday night by Maine Central Institute of Pittsfield athletic director and KVAC golf chairman Jim Leonard. 
The event will take place on Monday, Oct. 5 at 2 p.m. at RGC. 
Competing for the KVAC Class A title will be Messalonskee of Oakland, Lewiston and Brewer; while MCI, Mount View of Thorndike, Gardiner and Erskine Academy of South China will vie for the Class B conference crown. 
The Class B squads will play the front nine holes at RGC and Class A squads the back nine. 
Other upcoming postseason events include: 
• KVAC Class A and B state team and individual qualifier, Tuesday, Oct. 6 at Natanis. 
• Class A and B team championships, Saturday, Oct. 10 at Natanis. 
• State individual schoolboy and schoolgirl championships, Saturday, Oct. 17 at Natanis. 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
